title: MCL.io
author: MCL.io
created_time: January 23, 2023, 06:33:23 PMLast edit: January 25, 2023, 08:55:10 AM by MCL.io

comments.author: AmoreJaz
comments.body: the site should definitely remove KYC if you will be using MCL token in your site. but some players don't like the idea that their deposit will be automatically converted to MCL token that is not readily available in the trading market. is there an option that you can convert back the MCL token to the currency that you used for deposit? what trading platforms are listing MCL token?

comments.author: goinmerry
comments.body: KYC is really non-sense to ask right from the registration. What if users just want to test the site?I'm not saying KYC should be removed but at least, required instead in certain situations and not on the registration.It's tough and difficult to trust new gambling sites nowadays so if KYC will be required by these sites at the registration, I doubt they can attract more users.

comments.author: Yogee
comments.body: Quote from: MCL.io on January 23, 2023, 06:33:23 PM....The casino has removed KYC from the registration process, meaning that you can literally create your account within 30 seconds benefitting from a no verification casino process.Cool but nothing new here since many of the crypto casinos here have been implementing this for years.QuoteSpeed continues when it comes to payouts as well, with withdrawals processed within a matter of minutes.Withdrawal processed automatically? No manual intervention? This is also a good feature but not something new as well.You should think of something else if you want to claim that you're the best online casino. I'm also waiting for your response to AmoreJaz's question. What's the point of automatic conversion?

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: Quote from: Yogee on January 24, 2023, 12:54:00 AMQuote from: MCL.io on January 23, 2023, 06:33:23 PM....The casino has removed KYC from the registration process, meaning that you can literally create your account within 30 seconds benefitting from a no verification casino process.Cool but nothing new here since many of the crypto casinos here have been implementing this for years.Right. Actually, I have created accounts both on Freebitcoin and on Stake and neither of those have asked me for documents during the registration process.One can have one's account ready to go in just a minute, so I am afraid this feature which has been mentioned in this thread is nothing special. A casino needs more than shifty account creation to compete in this market.

comments.author: bittraffic
comments.body: What is the reason why the casino is prompting users to gitbook app when looking into the Privacy Policy? It forces users to link thier accounts to google and gitbook accounts. I think this is what your Deck infographic means when they connect blocks of the jigsaw puzzles. It's quite tricky to do this since the casino is collecting more data than just the KYC documents.

comments.author: leonair
comments.body: Quote from: AmoreJaz on January 23, 2023, 07:22:14 PMthe site should definitely remove KYC if you will be using MCL token in your site. but some players don't like the idea that their deposit will be automatically converted to MCL token that is not readily available in the trading market. is there an option that you can convert back the MCL token to the currency that you used for deposit? what trading platforms are listing MCL token?When a depositor's deposit is instantly converted into MCL tokens where this token is not yet listed on any good exchange I doubt how many people will come here to gamble. Gamblers always want to get their results instantly and they want to get everything easily.  So no one here will be interested in gambling to get MCL tokens using MCL tokens. kyc is not a big problem if a site is trusted and easy to use.Quote from: MCL.io on January 23, 2023, 07:42:22 PMQuote from: AmoreJaz on January 23, 2023, 07:22:14 PM Yes, there is an option to convert your MCL token back to the currency used for deposit. At the moment, MCL Token is listed on STEX, IDEX, and Hotbit. Other trading platforms will be announced soon.STEX, IDEX, and Hotbit completely shit exchangers. Hence the token listed in these cannot be considered as a potential token.  And when it comes to gambling with them, I doubt any potential gambler would gamble here

comments.author: traderethereum
comments.body: It's great if you remove KYC verification because, for crypto gamblers, KYC is very unpleasant and they always want to avoid it.But what if we win a lot of money and want to withdraw the winning money? Will you never ask us to do KYC?And preferably, your casino has main coins in addition to having your casino token coins so that crypto gamblers can have alternative coins for depositing.Before I forget, you should change the link above to Code:https://www.mcl-token.io/ because the link you provided becomes Code:ftp://https//www.mcl-token.io/.For the list of games, I think you can add other gambling games if you feel the need.

comments.author: EarnOnVictor
comments.body: Quote from: goinmerry on January 23, 2023, 11:59:33 PMKYC is really non-sense to ask right from the registration. What if users just want to test the site?I'm not saying KYC should be removed but at least, required instead in certain situations and not on the registration.It's tough and difficult to trust new gambling sites nowadays so if KYC will be required by these sites at the registration, I doubt they can attract more users.I see it differently from you, if casinos should be operated in a way that will protect both parties and avoid cheating and the nonchalant attitude of the operators, then they would be duly registered and regulated. And irrespective of testing, the KYC would be asked right at the registration time. This should be the norm for companies online that deal with money. I could only suspect desperation when casinos would not ask for the KYC at registration, while some are criminals themselves and they use the susceptibility of the internet to do as they like.They are such who might ask for the KYC later, while some might disappear with customers' money over time. And for the new casinos, they are truly not to be trusted, one should proceed with extreme caution.

comments.author: sportbettor
comments.created_time: January 24, 2023, 07:50:00 PMLast edit: January 25, 2023, 09:11:25 AM by sportbettor
comments.body: Quote from: MCL.io on January 23, 2023, 06:33:23 PMCreating an account with an online casino can be incredibly arduous, especially when it comes to verifying. The latest wave of no verification casinos removes all the red tape and allows you to create accounts in seconds with just an email address and password.You can check out one of such casinos here (withoutany KYC requirements): https://sportstatist.com/vave-review/

comments.author: SirLancelot
comments.body: Quote from: sportbettor on January 24, 2023, 07:50:00 PMQuote from: MCL.io on January 23, 2023, 06:33:23 PMCreating an account with an online casino can be incredibly arduous, especially when it comes to verifying. The latest wave of no verification casinos removes all the red tape and allows you to create accounts in seconds with just an email address and password.You can check out one of such casinos here (withoutany KYC requirements): http://sportstatist.com/vave-review/KYC is hassle but I think there are still gamblers who are willing to complete it as long as their withdrawals will get processed and it's up to them after that if they will still continue playing or not but for me ill will just continue since I can't get back my details anymore.We can still worry less as long as we know that the casino is old and trusted. KYC only becomes hard for those sites who are still new because we never knew their true intentions yet if they are here and serious for doing a business or they are only here to steal money and users information. Another thing that is needed is like you said to have a lot of coin options but a casino having its own coin is also kinda unique so some users will like it.

comments.author: TimeTeller
comments.body: Quote from: SirLancelot on January 24, 2023, 09:41:21 PMQuote from: sportbettor on January 24, 2023, 07:50:00 PMQuote from: MCL.io on January 23, 2023, 06:33:23 PMCreating an account with an online casino can be incredibly arduous, especially when it comes to verifying. The latest wave of no verification casinos removes all the red tape and allows you to create accounts in seconds with just an email address and password.You can check out one of such casinos here (withoutany KYC requirements): http://sportstatist.com/vave-review/KYC is hassle but I think there are still gamblers who are willing to complete it as long as their withdrawals will get processed and it's up to them after that if they will still continue playing or not but for me ill will just continue since I can't get back my details anymore.We can still worry less as long as we know that the casino is old and trusted. KYC only becomes hard for those sites who are still new because we never knew their true intentions yet if they are here and serious for doing a business or they are only here to steal money and users information. Another thing that is needed is like you said to have a lot of coin options but a casino having its own coin is also kinda unique so some users will like it.Or as long as the casino is top and reputable one. Better have an assurance that you will get your withdrawal, rather than waiting for days just to get it.What I have noticed here is that, reputable casinos or bookies in the forum have no problem when it comes to withdrawal even big ones.So are you going to take a risk for a small casino that you think may hold your withdrawal for no reason?But in any case, if you are utilizing your own casino token, should find more trading platforms so it won't be too difficult for your users to trade it with other currencies.

comments.author: bitbollo
comments.body: I have noticed that the main site has been posted as:Code:ftp:https://www.mcl-token.io/Is this a mistake or you plan that also an application should be opened?excluding the casino... what is the real usage for this token? I can spend only here or there are other place that can accept it? Where I can find more details about this token? I haven't find nothing on this site, but I see a big list of team member with "cartoon face" (only one account is accessible from linkedin and there are clearly no info...) Why there is a "donate" page ? Why you need people to donate bsc or btc?

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: I don't know about any other user here, but personally for me, I have never come across a casino that ask for kyc verification in the registration stage, that would be really stupid of such casino if you ask me , so far, i have accounts with several casino and like I said, non asked for kyc verification while i was registering, i have passed kyc verification on two casino which are Owl.games and stake.com, on Owl.games, i played for a while before i on my own decided to apply for kyc verification, I wasn't asked.Same goes for Stake.com, after signing up on stake, I abandoned my account for a while, and when i came back and decided to play there, i on my own decided to apply for KYC verification before i deposit and start playing, and the process was actually amazing, as it seemed easier, simple and seamless than I anticipated.

comments.author: stomachgrowls
comments.body: Quote from: Fivestar4everMVP on January 24, 2023, 10:23:17 PMI don't know about any other user here, but personally for me, I have never come across a casino that ask for kyc verification in the registration stage, that would be really stupid of such casino if you ask me , so far, i have accounts with several casino and like I said, non asked for kyc verification while i was registering, i have passed kyc verification on two casino which are Owl.games and stake.com, on Owl.games, i played for a while before i on my own decided to apply for kyc verification, I wasn't asked.Same goes for Stake.com, after signing up on stake, I abandoned my account for a while, and when i came back and decided to play there, i on my own decided to apply for KYC verification before i deposit and start playing, and the process was actually amazing, as it seemed easier, simple and seamless than I anticipated. Same experience or situation that had faced up or for sure for most people who had been dealing with crypto online casinos which most or all of them arent really asking for some KYC on the time that you do make outsome registration.These things could be found out on the time that you do win big or something that increases up your limits or trying to claim some bonuses which do requires these verification.You wouldnt really be that much minding if  ever you would really be that sending out those information if you do trust up the platform you've been dealing with.So far i havent sent one since im just a small fry gambler. hehe

comments.author: alegotardo
comments.body: Quote from: MCL.io on January 23, 2023, 06:33:23 PMMacau casino Lisboa is the best online casinos with easy verifications. These is site that have removed a lot of red tape and allow users to sign up, deposit, claim bonuses, and wager within a matter of minutesKYC is generally not required anywhere if the user just wants to register and use the site.Any user on virtually any online casino site can register with just email and password in a matter of minutes.The KYC "problem" only appears when the user wants to make very large withdrawals or deposits, and then there is not much to do.I've been checking the site you "indicated" and honestly I didn't like the way withdrawals are carried out, what kind of token is that? I'd rather perform KYC on sites I trust than risk withdrawals on something I may not be able to convert.

comments.author: len01
comments.body: removing KYC when registering is very good but I have the same question as another member, what if a gambler wins big on your gambling platform and wants to withdraw the funds? Will you be asked for KYC like other casinos?but actually even though you will be asked for KYC later when you want to withdraw a big win, it doesn't matter because it is as natural as other casinos. most importantly for small amount withdrawal i think no KYC needed.and a suggestion to the OP, if you really intend to market your gambling project it is better to create a single thread in the gambling section and respond to all the questions everyone here has. it would be better than you create a new thread with the same goal and leave without any more answers.maybe my advice you can consider.

comments.author: QueenVera
comments.body: There is a thread I came across recently about the UK government fining a casino over £400,000 if I'm not wrong because they get to ask their players to do KYC whenever they make huge wins and don't don't do same when they lose and at one point I felt the UK government wasn't fair but at some other point, I felt the casino deserved it and it would help serve as a warning to every other casino.You're new in this space a d I would personally advice that you get a copper membership first to display what you have to offer properly because most users wouldn't take this thread serious and secondly I want to also let you know that my attention was drawn to the fact that you never mentioned about KYC while making withdrawal and hope it wouldn't be an issue when making huge withdrawals?
